metadata.title: CVE-2019-13273 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In Xymon through 4.3.28, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in thecsvinfo CGI script. The overflow may be exploited by sending a crafted GETrequest that triggers an sprintf of the srcdb parameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13273` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xymon - 4.3.29-1
xymon-client - 4.3.29-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xymon package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.29-1').
